revised_title: The Role of Food Vacuoles in Infusoria Digestion: A Study on Carchesium Polypinum
tldr: The author investigates the formation and function of food vacuoles in infusoria, specifically in Carchesium polypinum. They observe the process of ingestion, digestion, and ejection, and describe the role of cilia in guiding and breaking down food particles. The study provides insights into the digestive cycle and the internal mechanisms of protozoa.
